result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:44 PM Defendant John L. Zinda in court.  Attorney Matthew H Huppertz in court for John L. Zinda.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense states that he has recently received some reports from the State and requests a new date in 45 days. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:41 AM Defendant John L. Zinda in court.  Attorney Matthew H Huppertz in court for John L. Zinda. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. Victim B appears by zoom w/Victim Witness. 

Defense states that the State is working on a global offer, and asks for a status date in 45-60 days. 
RE: WCS non-compliance. Defense states that Defendant made a payment today to WCS, and the Defendant did not go to the victim's residence. Defense requests that the Court take no action on bail. 
State requests an admonishment re: non-compliance. 
Court admonishes Defendant re: bail conditions.
Hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter filed by the State requesting the victim be allowed to appear by Zoom.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Defendant John L. Zinda in court with attorney Matthew H Huppertz. 

Defense is requesting time to hire a private investigator.  Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on April 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:34 AM Defendant John L. Zinda in court with Attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Huppertz is asking for the March 14, 2022 at 2:00 PM date previously set be rescheduled.  The Court will reschedule that date before the Trial Court.  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Dated 03-04-2022 - Filed by DA's Office, requesting for approval to have one or more victims appear via Zoom for the Preliminary Hearing on 03-07-2022 at 8:15 am. Sent for review to Commissioner Kevin Costello on 03-04-2022.

  **Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 03-04-2022 - Granted. **
Atty. Matthew Huppertz

Payable Number: 459609,
Amount: $20.00
Order on Petition for Appointment of Attorney _AMENDED

ADDRESS INFO for John L. Zinda
Current: 2810 Buckingham Court, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 02-03-2022)
Prior: 2821 Silvernail Rd, Pewaukee, WI 53072

Preliminary hearing on March 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on March 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court will do the following bail modification.
CONDITIONS:
MODIFIED ON 02/03/22:  DEFENDANT CAN NOT BE IN THE BACK YARD OF HIS FATHER'S RESIDENCE. DEFENDANT IS PERMITTED TO GO TO THE RESIDENCE WITH A POLICE ESCORT TO RETREIVE HIS TRUCK, CLOTHES AND PERSONAL BELONGINGS TO BE COMPLETED WITHIN THE NEXT 10 DAYS.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with ANY OF THE VICTIMS OR WITNESSES LISTED IN THE Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  
Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile (with the exception that the defendant can be in the property his father owns) of Victim A/Witness A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  
Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.

Defense waives time limits for prelim.

Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John L. Zinda in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.
Victims appeared by zoom.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Court to Address:  GPS Monitoring as a Conditon of Bond.  

State presented bail arguments to the court.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with ANY OF THE VICTIMS OR WITNESSES LISTED IN THE Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  
Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile (with the exception that the defendant can be in the property his father owns) of Victim A/Witness A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  
Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.

records.addlTxt:
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant John L. Zinda in court, in custody, by phone.
Victim B appeared in court by zoom.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Defendant stated he doesn't qualify for public defender representation.
Defendant is requesting the court appoint counsel.
Court swears in the defendant - Colloquy conducted.
Court Grants - Appointment of Counsel
Court to appoint counsel.
Defendant to post $25 per month, starting 04/15/22

State addressed with the court non-compliance with WCS - Non-Payment of GPS.
Defendant presented statements to the court - Defendant now has the GPS reinstalled and activated.
State is requesting a formal bail motion be scheduled once counsel is appointed to the defendant.
Court will appoint Attorney Peter Wolff at the public defender rate on both cases.
Court is not in a position to modify bond at this time and will schedule the matter to address bail on the State's motion.

Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1,000 feet of Victim A and B's residence or place of employment, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.
